intro: Lannea schweinfurthii var. schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African milkwood tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and thick, waxy leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and on mountain slopes. The plant is also noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it valuable in soil enrichment.
